meanings.definition: To value or esteem too highly
meanings.sent1: She overprizes her old teddy bear, thinking it's the most valuable thing in the world.
meanings.sent2: He often overprizes his own abilities, believing he can do anything better than others.
meanings.sent3: The cat overprizes the empty box, thinking it's a luxurious castle for her.
meanings.sent4: The artist overprizes his first painting, seeing it as a masterpiece beyond compare.
meanings.sent5: The child overprizes the shiny rock, convinced it's a rare gem worth a fortune.

meanings.definition: To set too high a value on
meanings.sent1: They overprize the antique vase, thinking it's worth a fortune.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overprize material possessions, believing they define her worth.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overprizes the acorn, hiding it in multiple secret spots.
meanings.sent4: The coach overprizes winning, forgetting the importance of fair play.
meanings.sent5: He overprizes his collection of stamps, considering each one a rare treasure.

meanings.sent1: The teacher overprizes punctuality, rewarding students who arrive early.
meanings.sent2: He overprizes his car, spending more time cleaning it than driving.
meanings.sent3: The chef overprizes presentation, making each dish a work of art.
meanings.sent4: She overprizes her appearance, constantly seeking validation through looks.
meanings.sent5: The gardener overprizes symmetry, ensuring each side of the garden is perfectly balanced.
